column2: text
Halfling of the People
Fieldwardens are esteemed figures in Halfling society, they know everyone and everyone knows them. Their sole presence can instill courage in the heart of fellow Halflings.
Friendly Competition
The presence of a Fieldwarden often leads nearby Halflings to try and outdo each other in an effort to impress the Fieldwarden.
Border Patrols
Lone Fieldwardens are often posted in the forests and hills at the borders of the Moot in order to stop any covert enemy incursions.
Defender of the Moot
And stay out, unless you want the next one to hit something more sensitive!
The Art of Cooking
A true master of his craft, the dishes of the Master Chef are so potent that they can alter the course of battle. Yes, with food, these are Haflings we're talking about.
Beef & Beer Pie
The smell of Halfling pies actually could raise the dead from the grave. Might even be why the Undead keep invading.
The Feast is Coming!
Doesn't matter if you're a Halfling, an Ogre or something else, the promise of good grub is worth fighting for.
Hot Spices
Recently imported from Lustria, these curious red thin peppers emit a pungent smell even from a good distance.
In Defense of the Moot
The Halflings of the Moot are a peaceful and pastoral people, but their bravery in defence of their homeland against Undead and Greenskin incursions should not be doubted
For All That Is Pure and Good
They have mistaken our love of peace for weakness! To battle, for the Moot!
Spill the Soup!
On a desperate situation, the Master Chef will spill a pot containing the famously explosive "Hot Pot" stew recipe on nearby enemies.... and himself.
Smallfolk Luck
Halflings seem to be preternaturally lucky and oddly resistant to even the darkest, dangerous magic.
Some Master Chefs choose to carry their kitchen onto the battlefield in a chuck wagon.
Many Halfling commanders choose to ride pigs into battle. Hey, what, stop laughing.
Many Halfling commanders choose to ride the largest Moot Cockerel specimens into battle.
